About Jessica Moseley

Hi! I’m Jessica Barnett, a pianist and music theorist in Buffalo, NY. I’m a Ph.D graduate of the Cincinnati Conservatory of Music, where I wrote dissertation on “Clouds, Clusters, and Constellations” in Alberto Ginastera’s music. I also got an M.M. in music theory from CCM with a cognate in piano pedagogy, and studied piano at Drake University with Chiu-ling Lin.

I have taught music theory, piano, and collaborated with musicians at CCM, Hofstra University, Furman University, and the University at Buffalo.

When I’m not making music with friends, you might find me making pasta at home, gardening, volunteering at Buffalo String Works, writing an article about Alberto Ginastera. Or, eating wings. And in my spare time, I’m the mother to a rambunctious Yorkshire Terrior and wife to a coffee-addicted, UB professor and musician.

Contact Me
